comment: She is a really good professor and understands the difficulty of learning a language. It's really inspiring to see someone who is american learn a language fluently because it gives you hope that you achieve that too. She is a very fair grader and tries to help when she can. It can be a lot of work sometimes but once you get the hang of VHL itseasy
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Professor Holton, was a very great teacher. I took her online French class and it was very easy. I feel that the hardest part of the class would be where we would have conversations with other classmates in complete French. However, if you study enough and pay attention, you will be just fine.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Holton was exceptional. She was available for questions. I wish that she taught all of the french classes.

one of the easier French classes I've taken. she's been doing online classes for a few years so she does a good job utilizing all types of online teaching sources. the tests though can be really hard because some if you're not 100% right then you get no partial credit. its gonna take a decent amount of studying

Prof Holton is a great professor! She really does help you any way she can and is very flexible! I took her class online and while there was quite a lot of assignments and homework, it did make it a little easier when you missed one or did poorly on a test. She doesn't grade super harshly either which definitely helps. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is honestly an amazing teacher! I took her class online and its a lot of work but if you follow a solid schedule and get it done its not that bad. Don't procrastinate and you'll be fine!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: I learned more from her class than any other French teacher I've had. Take her if you can!

She's a nice person, but here's an honest breakdown of my experience in her class: over the course of the semester, she gave out 69 hw assignments according to the VHL sight. 5 tests back-to-back for the last 2 weeks of class. 9 to 10 exams total (including oral exams). Clearly doesn't recognize that we have jobs & classes. You will be stressed.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Super nice prof. Very approachable, very accessible, very helpful. She typically plays French music before class starts and I've been introduced to a lot of great artists because of her! She's got a good teaching style as well and really seems to enjoy what she's doing, which makes me enjoy it! She's ridiculously cute, too.
Best French teacher I've ever had. Please take her if you have a chance!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Molly is the best French teacher I've had. She's super adorable and very kind. She understands how to teach beginners very well and takes her time to make sure you're getting it. As long as you pay attention to her lectures and do the homework, you should do well! Always had a good time in her class, she makes everyone feel like they're friends.
she is beautiful and a very relaxed teacher, she has really goods vibes. It makes no sense to get a C in her class

Better than my French 1 teacher, she used to teach high school so she is very nice! Short lectures and also lets out early. Easy grader and knows the culture, American who lived in Paris. She knows what she's doing and cares for students. Very cool teacher, a must take!

Professor Molly is great! She is always willing to help. She doesn't mind you asking questions or repeating things in different ways so her students get a better understanding. There is daily homework and her test include a writing, listening and question sections. She prepares you well, but it does take out of class time to be prepared. So STUDY !

Great French teacher!!! Always willing to help and understands that her students aren't all fluent in French. She is very easy to learn from and is extremely patient. I would definitely recommend her! Took one French class in high school so I was very nervous about taking it in college but she made it fun. Do homework and go to class.
